news.title: JPMorgan Chase tops quarterly expectations as Dimon says U.S. economy faces ‘considerable turbulence’
news.summary: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon touted his company's solid results in the quarter. He also struck a note of caution on the broader economy.

news.title: Wholesale prices unexpectedly fell 0.4% in March, showing easing inflation backdrop ahead of tariffs
news.summary: The producer price index declined a seasonally adjusted 0.4% for the month. The index is considered a leading indicator for pipeline inflation pressures.

news.title: Fed's Kashkari says rising bond yields, falling dollar show investors are moving on from the U.S.
news.summary: The trends are running counter to what you might normally see, the central bank official told CNBC. The trends are run counter to the normal trends, the official said.

news.title: China strikes back with 125% tariffs on U.S. goods as trade war intensifies
news.summary: U.S. tariff rate on Chinese imports now effectively totals 145%. Trump administration confirmed to CNBC that the U.S.-China trade war is at an all-time high.

news.title: Morgan Stanley tops quarterly estimates as equity trading revenue surges 45%
news.summary: Shares of Morgan Stanley have whipsawed in recent days amid President Donald Trump's trade policies. Morgan Stanley is one of the largest banks in the U.S.

news.title: Cheaper oil produces first decline in wholesale prices in 17 months. But inflation far from dead as trade wars heat up.
news.summary: Producer price index was tame in March. Producer price index rose 0.2% in March from February. Producer prices rise 0.3% from February, down 0.1% from January.

news.title: Investors are shunning America. This wealth management giant says, actually, U.S. stocks are attractive.
news.summary: The S&P 500 looks attractive. Improving trade news and overly-depressed sentiment leaves the S&P 500 looking attractive.

news.title: Morgan Stanley earnings boosted by record equity trading
news.summary: Bank of America's stock trading rose 45% to $4.1 billion in latest quarter. Bank of America’s stock trading increased 45% in latest quarterly quarter.

news.title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon warns economy is facing ‘considerable turbulence’ from tariffs and trade wars
news.summary: Jamie Dimon cited “sticky inflation, high fiscal deficits and still rather high asset prices and volatility” in his remarks. Dimon: “Still rather high Asset Prices and Volatility”

news.title: Wells Fargo’s CEO sees more volatility due to tariffs, is ready for slower economy
news.summary: “The actual outcome will be dependent on the results and timing of the policy changes,” Wells Fargo’s CEO said.
